description.narrative: Micronutrient Initiative (MI) programming improves the health and nutritional status of adolescent girls and women of reproductive age; pregnant women and their new-borns; and infants and young children – to reduce mortality, anaemia, birth defects, low birth weight and stunting. Micronutrient Initiative has implemented a number of interventions with local governments and other partners across a number of high-burden countries in Africa and Asia including: Bangladesh, Ethiopia, Kenya, India, Nigeria, Pakistan and Senegal. MI in collaboration with Action Against Hunger (ACF-USA Kenya mission) plans to conduct a survey in areas of operation across Kenya. In the need to understand the coverage of its programming in country, which will be used as a baseline for monitoring its programs, MI plans to conduct a Program coverage survey in collaboration with ACF. This is due to ACF’s immense expertise in surveys and assessment and the close collaboration it has with the Ministry of Health. ACF has presence already is some of the Counties where the assessment will be carried and this provide easy time in leveraging resources available.

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
Actual start date of the activity
